edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_library.util

Class MultiPurposeList<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_library.util.MultiPurposeList<T>

  • public class MultiPurposeList<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    The multipurpose list class instantiates a multipurpose list given a generic type T.
    Author:
    Marcus

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultiPurposeList()
      The constructor simply sets the head node to null.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addItem(int pos, T temp)
      The add item method inserts an item into the linked list at a given position.
      void addToRear(T item)
      The add to read method adds an item to the rear of the list.
      boolean hasNext()
      The has next method returns true if the iterator is pointing to a list element.
      boolean isEmpty()
      The is empty method examines the list to see if it is empty.
      T lookAtItemN(int pos)
      The look at item method examines the item in the list at a given position.
      void moveAheadOne(int pos)
      The move ahead method moves an element forward one position in the list.
      T next()
      The next method returns the data of the node that the iterator currently points to.
      T remove(int pos)
      The remove method removes an item from the list at a given position.
      void resetIterator()
      The reset iterator method moves the iterator back to the first element of the list.
      int size()
      The size method runs the iterator through the list to count the number of elements.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiPurposeList

        public MultiPurposeList()
        The constructor simply sets the head node to null.

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        public void addItem(int pos,
           T temp)
        The add item method inserts an item into the linked list at a given position.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position of the item to be added
        temp - the item to add to the list

      • lookAtItemN

        public T lookAtItemN(int pos)
        The look at item method examines the item in the list at a given position.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position of the item requested
        Returns:
        the data requested at a specific position

      • addToRear

        public void addToRear(T item)
        The add to read method adds an item to the rear of the list.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to add to the rear of the list

      • remove

        public T remove(int pos)
        The remove method removes an item from the list at a given position. It sends the iterator down the list once to find the item. Since it will have already passed the item at that point, the iterator will then need to run through it once more to remove the item one element before the item it found on the first traversal through the list.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position of the item to remove
        Returns:
        the item that was removed

      • moveAheadOne

        public void moveAheadOne(int pos)
        The move ahead method moves an element forward one position in the list. If the position is 0, the method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        pos - the item to advance forward

      • size

        public int size()
        The size method runs the iterator through the list to count the number of elements.
        Returns:
        size the number of elements in the list.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        The is empty method examines the list to see if it is empty. It examines the head node to see if it's null.
        Returns:
        true if the list is empty and false otherwise

      • resetIterator

        public void resetIterator()
        The reset iterator method moves the iterator back to the first element of the list.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        The has next method returns true if the iterator is pointing to a list element.
        Returns:
        true if the iterator is pointing to a list element and false otherwise.

      • next

        public T next()
        The next method returns the data of the node that the iterator currently points to. If the iterator returns null, the element must have no data, and so the method throws a no such element exception.
        Returns:
        the data of the node that the iterator currently points to
